Event.0: R&B singer Usher (30) divorces hair stylist and wardrobe stylist Tameka Foster (38) due to irretrievably broken marriage after 2 years
Event.1: Barack Obama becomes the first African-American to be elected President of the United States, defeating Republican candidate John McCain
Event.2: Democratic politician Barack Obama became the first African American to be elected president of the United States.
Event.3: "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone" 1st film adaptation of the books by J. K. Rowling, premieres starring Daniel Radcliffe
Event.4: The first film adaptation of J.K. Rowling's best-selling Harry Potter series, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, premiered in London.
Event.5:
Yitzhak Rabin assassinated
Israeli Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin, corecipient with Shimon Peres and Yāsir ʿArafāt of the Nobel Prize for Peace in 1994, was assassinated this day in 1995 by a Jewish extremist while attending a peace rally.
Event.6: Nia Peeples files for divorce from Howard Hewett
Event.7: NBA announces 4 new franchises; Charlotte & Miami for 1988 & Minneapolis & Orlando for 1989
Event.8: Conservative Republican Ronald Reagan was elected the 40th president of the United States.
Event.9: A hostage crisis in Iran began as the U.S. embassy in Tehrān was seized by Iranian militants in a move sanctioned by Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.
Event.10:
Sean Combs
American rapper, record producer, and clothing designer
was born
Event.11:
Matthew McConaughey
American actor
was born
Event.12:
Kathy Griffin
American comedian and actress
was born
Event.13:
Tony Abbott
prime minister of Australia
was born
Event.14: UNESCO was officially established as its constitution entered into force; this specialized agency of the UN called for the promotion of international collaboration in education, science, and culture.
Event.15:
Laura Welch Bush
American first lady
was born
Event.16: American author and journalist "The Old Man and the Sea" Ernest Hemingway divorces 2nd wife Pauline Pfeiffer
Event.17: Actress and comedian Phyllis Diller (22) weds inspector Sherwood Diller in Covington, Kentucky
Event.18: British archaeologist Howard Carter discovered the tomb of the Egyptian pharaoh Tutankhamen.
Event.19: Howard Carter discovers tomb of Tutankhamun in Egypt
Event.20: Charles I of Austria marries Princess Zita of Bourbon-Parma
Event.21: African American inventor Thomas Elkins patents refrigerating apparatus
Event.22: Johannes Brahms' 1st Symphony in C premieres in Karlsruhe, Grand Duchy of Baden
Event.23: Dr Richard Gatling patents Gatling machine gun in Indianapolis
Event.24: U.S. first lady Mary Todd Lincoln (23) weds US President Abraham Lincoln (33) in Springfield, Illinois
Event.25: Future U.S. president Abraham Lincoln married Mary Todd.
Event.26: First wagon train arrives in California
Event.27: In what became known as St. Clair's Defeat, U.S. General Arthur St. Clair was beaten by the British-supported Northwest Indian Confederation.
Event.28: Eighty Years' War: In Flanders, Spanish defeat Walloon and capture Antwerp
